title: `Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix:1 ...`
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Fresh install of Ubuntu, after Nvidia installs, deeplabcut-docker gui and deeplabcut_docker.sh fail to launch.

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04.3 virtualized

### DeepLabCut version

Docker, latest

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Virtualized CPU, passed through GPU Tesla M40 24 GB

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Install Ubuntu 20.04.3 and apply updates
2. Install Nvidia driver (.run file), CUDA 11.5 (online), libcudnn8
3. Install Docker and pip
4. pip install deeplabcut-docker
5. deeplabcut-docker.sh results in error: FileNotFoundError
6. deeplabcut-docker gui results in error (on both X11 forwarding and local display): Failed to launch the DLC GUI

### Relevant log output

```shell
deeplabcut-docker.sh FileNotFoundError:

                    .--,       .--,
                    ( (  \.---./  ) )
                     '.__/o   o\__.'
                       `{=  ^  =}Â´

\_________________________________________________________/

                      (((__) (__)))      ~`

Welcome to DeepLabCut docker!

    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/ryan/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/deeplabcut_docker.py", line 71, in main
    pty.spawn(argv)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/pty.py", line 158, in spawn
    os.execlp(argv[0], *argv)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 551, in execlp
    execvp(file, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 568, in execvp
    _execvpe(file, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 610, in _execvpe
    raise last_exc
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/os.py", line 601, in _execvpe
    exec_func(fullname, *argrest)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
Container stopped.

[2021-12-16T23:50:33-0500]: Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix:1 -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v :/home/developer/.Xauthority -v /home/ryan/.local/bin:/app -w /app "
```


### Anything else?
